title: Closing

moderator: Colin de la Higuera, LINA, University of Nantes

segmentation: Basically.
I want to just talk about was give you some figures about what's happened, who was here.
Talk about the web camp.
I think Yuri will be not far to tell you about some exciting event happening tomorrow.

Laura D. It was already in the booklet about media coverage and about social media coverage and perhaps finish off with some lessons learned or some legacy that we could pass on to the next people so.
You can't see much because we put the list of all the countries where you can see.
You can read their different countries.
You can see that we had about 250 people who registered out of which quite logically Slovenia was most numerous, which is nice.
What is nice is if you start looking you see all the European countries and that was also one of the goals was to make sure that perhaps more things happen in Europe at least they are here.
They have been here to bring back messages in their different countries so.
I think we can say that that was a success.
The media coverage so probably can't all read this.
Just say that you saw the press on the first day.
Well, the press actually then used what they did here to pass on in the main newspapers on the blogs and even on television.
And so there's a number of elements where people have talked about this.
Obviously the fact that opening in Slovenia was officially or was launched.
Or re explain at the same time.
May have made a big impact.
So here are some examples of bits and pieces.
Where the conference was mentioned.

Um, another bit of impact was the fact that the Commissioner released a statement when she came to indicate how important she thought that the opening up Slovenia was and the fact that this took place during the conference, which is here so you know, if you read it, you can see that there's an event promoting open courseware.
Was was weather Vasiliou came and talked to us, so that was also important that one of the goals was to see how we can.
Help influence Europe in the in in promoting these things so so we're happy about it.
So yes, so in between things we we have this other event which is the web Cam.
So yes come come up and Europe will say a little bit about it because it was linked and it's also going to be successful.
Right, so as extension of this conference, we are organizing a webcam tomorrow, faculty of Computer Information Sciences kindly gave us there.

Well, the horse and the idea is that if you're a developer or if you're interested in working with local developers, we have about 200 tomorrow and we'll be talking about all sorts of nifty modern buzzwords.
So show up tomorrow at 9:00 and all information is in booklet, so hopefully see you.
Thank you, thank you.
So some lessons learned so further two big lessons that I've learned to, well, I feel a certain number of us have learned to do once we were here.

One of them is related to the fact that we've all enjoyed being in Slovenia, and the good news is that opening up Slovenia will probably give us occasions to come back because things are going to happen.
There will be possibly events or other occasions where people interested in open educational resources will feel tempted to come back to Slovenia and see how well the project is going so.
So that is one of the lessons learned.
The second lesson learned is, and the fact that we did a team up to organisations.
We teamed up in between OC WC and in between knowledge for all.
And as you've guessed, the people in machine learning and we've we felt that it was a good combination.
We felt that we managed to have a nicely balanced conference where policies and pedagogy with.

As interesting as they always are and where there were a number of research talks and off researchers who did come to present their work and not just to present their work, but also to be aware of where the challenges are and what the questions people are needing and that researchers can work on.
So we are hoping that this will also continue and we are, as I said yesterday, to a number of people completely prepared to help in whatever way we can through.
The research channels too.
Um?
Before seeing this, which I'm not going to say, which is just the way of saying Slovenian, well, see you next year in Athabasca.
That's what at least the translation seems to be.
We also have to say thank you to a number of people say they were great troops that worked in both teams.
Then there's all the other people.
The yellow T shirts.
Are they still around?
I mean, they've done a great great job.
I mean, we've been discreet, but there's always been a microphone, a technician to give us a hand.
So that was absolutely wonderful.
Yes, yes, come on, let's go.
This.
This being the all this cyantific people the people from the program Committee, the program, the the different shares of the sessions, the speakers themselves.
So all the people who made this scientifically interesting.
Well, I'd like to say to say thank you too.
Um?
A special thanks to the people who have manned the registration desks is bizarre.
To use the word manned in this case, but they were there.
They were there all the time.
They've answered lots of questions.
They've got everything going and where really, really happy about that, and the fact that they mandate from feminine POV well has led Davor here.
Who has the good ideas usually in the team that you say?
Well, you know, perhaps we could, you know, be gentleman and invite them too.
Come here, I know they don't want to come on stage, but they can come at the foot of the stage, choose sort of well, receive your thanks.
So I'm thinking specifically about Stella and Monica.
I'll be there, they haven't escaped.
See, come on.
And at the same time, since we are being nice with the ladies.
Bravo, thanks a lot.
I mean the work they have done this absolutely formidable.
Thank you a lot.
Where is she?
Thank you very much and to all others who supported our team.
OK, lovely.
And thanks a lot.
Thank you very much.
We would like to say thank you to other ladies.
There's been ladies in the OSW C who have been really of great help so I'd like Mina.
I'd like marcella.
I'd like Mary Lou who is already here to come and I hope I have and we have also wanted to ask Oona to come if she still around.
Please on stage.
Devil will do the kissing.
This is eating cake.
Thank you very much.
OK, well we don't have Flowers for all the men that have helped.
Sorry bout that.
So I think that's about it.
I mean we have finished a great conference.
There's going to be news that you will receive by Mail news about the papers, news about the slides, news about the videos.
Remember that all these videos will be online in I think, about a month's time.
It takes time to treat them to, to get them into onto the server.
Um, and that's about it.
We just, you know, hope pass on the the best to Athabasca for them to be as lucky as we wear with a great crowd and the great offers.
Thank you very much.
Donna.
We'd be completely remiss if we didn't mention at least mention the men from our team.
We have ego Igor Lesko, who.
Many of you have interacted with.
And of course you know you saw a moment ago.
And then we absolutely must thank our fabulous local organizers, Micha and Davor.
And a great round of applause for Colin, who's very modest and doesn't want to take credit.
But he deserves a lot of credit for this program.
So thank you very much, Colin.
Alright, we wish you all safe travels and we'll see you at Athabasca.
